data.title: [cosmetic] exported var switches to title case in editor
data.body:
This is, as far as I'm aware, just a cosmetic/polish/consistency issue, but it should (eventually) be corrected. Variables in GDscript are case-sensitive, but if you export a variable and look at it in the property editor, the case of the variable name is changed to title case.

Example:
    export var myExportedVar = 5
Then look at the property inspector, and it shows "Myexportedvar".

Another example, underscores are removed completely:
    export var mY_EPORTED_vAR = 5
This will become "My Eported Var".

data.title: Close scene confirmation popup is appearing in inconsistent way
data.body:
Please, remove the warning that says you are going to lose unsaved changes if there arent any new changes since last save....

Its scary... :)

data.title: Suggestion: allow exporting into project folder
data.body:
I tried exporting a project into a new subfolder I created in the project folder, labeled "build/". Godot then told me I shouldn't export into the project folder. Yet the folder I tried to export into is a clean one and it makes logical sense to me to export it there, as it's a part of the game.

It would be nice if exporting into a safe folder inside the project directory was allowed, or maybe even provided by default.

data.title: Collision body_enter signal and Collisions in general
data.body:
Already talked in irc about this topic.
Rigidbody that is set to "rigid" is the only type which can perform a body_enter signal.
When set to "static" or "kinematic" no body_enter signal is triggered which is unfortunate.

Here is an example project which demonstrates the behavior.

Also I would like to suggest a new type for collision shapes. It would be nice if we could set them to ghost. This will only trigger a collision signal but lets the objects intersect. I know collision shapes have a Trigger boolean. This lets objects intersect but does not trigger a body_enter signal.
In general it would be nice if area2d nodes can detect other area2d nodes. This is not possible either. 

https://www.dropbox.com/s/v92amwfy0ohw0bx/collisions.zip

data.title: Complex editor operations and bugs
data.body: There is a piece of code: ``` cpp _remove_text(selection.from_line,selection.from_column,selection.to_line,selection.to_column); _insert_text_at_cursor(txt); ``` (at https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/blob/master/scene/gui/text_edit.cpp#L1077) commits removing and inserting. It works fine but not with undo. When user presses `Ctrl+z` text disappears and then (after next `Ctrl+z`) appears again shifted to the left. Obviously it is a bug. The question is how to implement a complex operation so that `_remove_text()` and `_insert_text()` appears as a single operation for undo. In my case there is a text which I want to surround with quotes (or braces) and it needs two insert operation: before and after selected text or one remove and one insert. So it is like in the example above. P.S. I found `TextOperation.chain_forward` at https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/blob/master/scene/gui/text_edit.h#L158 but looks like it is never used.

data.title: XOR is not applicable on bools
data.body:
```
var b1 = true
var b2 = b1 ^ true
```

crashes with 

```
invalid operands 'bool' and 'bool' in operator '^ '
```

if works with integers though. the following code works :

```
var b1 = 1
var b2 = b ^ 1
```

data.title: Unwanted blurring in tiles placed inside a viewport node
data.body:
I'm trying to use Viewport (set as render target) and ViewportSprite nodes to make a simple scanline effect for my 16-bit style platform-game project. It works, but I noticed that the tiles rendered inside the TileMap node are blurred, even if you disable all the relevant filtering options in the project settings. 

This happens only with a TileMap node inside a Viewport node. Instead, a Sprite node placed inside the same Viewport node doesn't have this blurring.

To check the probem yourself you can download a simple test project here:
http://www.filedropper.com/amigamagictestblurringtar_1

P.S.: tested on a Linux machine with latest godot development sources (15 Apr 2014) pulled from github.

data.title: controls don't respond properly with horizontal 2D stretching
data.body:
I noticed that when using the new stretch_mode = 2D and stretch_aspect = keep / keep_width, controls look like they're positioned correctly, but they are responding to input incorrectly.

For example, make a small scene, add some buttons. Run it and maximize the window. Now you have to move your mouse to the right of the button to trigger the visual "hover" feedback, and to be able to click it.

This only applies to the horizontal positioning - vertical seems to be fine, and the problem doesn't appear when stretch_aspect is set to keep_height.

data.title: Not working android build because of .fscache bug related to game assets update
data.body:
Hey there..
If I add new resources to my project and then try to export the project to my android device the game does not start. Logcat shows that the newely added resources are not found.
Checking the .fscache file showed me, that the new resources were not added. Fix for that is deleting the .fscache and then restarting the project which creates a new .fscache.
This seems to be a write permission issue?

I'm running godot in a Mac OSX Mavericks latest version 10.9.2, and can't create a simple string "simple string" or 'simple string', because pressing ' or " causes nothing. My keyboard is configured with international english, and i'm using dead keys. The godot version is v1.0.4147-beta1.

And thank you very much for the nice project, i'm will try more and wanna help more in future :+1:

data.title: A possible thread conflict.
data.body:
In a scene with a various collision nodes, each node is a instance that call a function in Player node.
My Player collides with two nodes at same time and cause a crashes in the game window and close it, a debugger instance is lose too.

Its issue not occurs  in all time, but the little incidence (almost 10%) is worrying.

I hope these info can help.
#### scene

![captura de tela de 2014-04-14 19 10 40](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/85936/2702798/7492560c-c43d-11e3-85c6-6098d856a66e.jpg)
#### Node Healt

```
extends Area2D

var taken=false

var player = null
var playerDT = null

var tipo = "healt"
var value = 20

func _on_body_enter( body ):
    if (not taken ): #and body extends player):
        taken=true
        playerDT.incHealt(value)
        get_parent().remove_child(self)

func _ready():
    player = get_node("/root/stage/Player")
    playerDT = get_node("/root/playerdata")
```

data.title: Add Breakpoint at runtime
data.body: It is impossible to add a breakpoint at runtime.  Debugger will ignore it. Only after restart bebugger will stop at it.

data.title: Add support for double precision floats
data.body:
Since I need more number precision for my game, I tried to recompile the engine with REAL_T_IS_DOUBLE, however it doesn't work.

It seems like float have been used here and there in place of the abstract real_t type.
In the other hand b2ConvexDecomp::float32 is defined as real_t... and real_t can be a double precision float (float64). So it is quite confusing.

data.title: Scaling an instance doesn't work
data.body:
Moving and rotating an instance works fine but scaling does not work. The instance scales fine in the editor but the scale is ignored when the game is running.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Follow the instancing tutorial at https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/tutorial_instancing
2. Scale one of the balls by either dragging the scale handles or editing the Scale property.
3. Press play

I expected the instance to have the same size in the game as in the editor.

Multiple balls with different position, rotation and scaling:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20253/2687810/0df73e4c-c26e-11e3-896b-e085bdbb0400.png)

Game engine only respects the position and rotation and not scaling:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20253/2687809/f2e26f6e-c26d-11e3-8705-90e0e77f9935.png)

data.title: home button & whitespace
data.body:
There was a question:
Home button in editor moves cursor not to first non-space symbol but to the real beginning. Is it possible to change?
and this
Home moves to the first non-space character, and if Home is pressed while already at the first non-space character, then it takes you to the very start of the line? best of both worlds that way.
So this commit fix editor in this way. P.S. I suppose that it will be useful to add new editor settings param . I can try to do it later.
